title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #856: LCM-Free Sets**

Estimate f_k(N) = max harmonic sum of subsets with no k elements having uniform pairwise LCM.

**Status:** OPEN

**Best bounds:** (log N)^{b_k} ≤ f_k(N) ≤ (log N)^{c_k}
mathContext: Connects to sunflower conjecture: c_k < 1 iff sunflower conjecture holds for k.

title: Least Common Multiple
content:
**myLcm a b:** lcm(a,b) = ab/gcd(a,b)

Basic properties: lcm(a,b) = lcm(b,a), lcm(a,a) = a.

title: Uniform Pairwise LCM
content:
**HasUniformPairwiseLCM A t:** All distinct pairs in A have lcm = t.

This is the forbidden structure: we want sets avoiding k elements with this property.

title: LCM-Free Set
content:
**IsLCMFree A k:** A contains no k-subset with uniform pairwise LCM.

These are the sets we're maximizing over.

title: Harmonic Sum
content:
**harmonicSum A:** Σ_{n∈A} 1/n

This measures logarithmic density, contrasting with natural density |A|.

title: f_k(N)
content:
**f_k k N:** Maximum harmonic sum over k-LCM-free subsets of {1,...,N}.

This is the quantity we want to estimate.

title: Erdős Upper Bound
content:
**erdos_1970_upper_bound:**

f_k(N) ≪ log(N)/log(log(N))

Proof uses: for every t, there are < k solutions to t = ap with a ∈ A and p prime.
mathContext: From 'Some extremal problems in combinatorial number theory' (1970).

title: Tang-Zhang Bounds
mathContext: Published in 2025, significantly improving Erdős's bound.

title: k=3 Bounds
Sunflower
content:
**IsSunflower sets k:** A k-sunflower is k sets where any two have the same intersection (core).

**SunflowerConjectureForK k:** Large families contain k-sunflowers.
mathContext: The sunflower conjecture is a major open problem in combinatorics.

title: Sunflower Connection
content:
**sunflower_connection:**

c_k < 1 (non-trivial upper bound) ⟺ sunflower conjecture holds for k.

This deep connection relates two seemingly different problems.

title: Natural Density Variant
content:
**g_k k N:** Maximum |A| over k-LCM-free subsets.

**erdos_natural_density_k4:** g_4(N) ≫ N

Erdős showed sets of linear size can avoid 4-element uniform LCM subsets.

title: Summary
content:
**erdos_856_summary:**

1. Problem is OPEN
2. Erdős gave initial bound log(N)/log(log(N))
3. Tang-Zhang improved to polynomial powers of log N
4. Connected to sunflower conjecture

**Goal:** Determine precise growth rate of f_k(N).
